name: 資產管理
description:
There has been a proliferation of new products and strategies in the asset
management space in recent years. This course applies portfolio theory to
understand and evaluate these products and strategies in the context of the empirical
evidence about return patterns across assets in multiple markets/asset classes. The
basic theoretical framework is standard portfolio theory, as developed in
Foundations of Finance, and its extensions. The course covers the institutional
landscape of the asset management business-the firms (e.g., Fidelity, Vanguard), the
vehicles (e.g., mutual funds, ETFs, hedge funds), and the trends (e.g., active vs.
passive, fee competition).
